Message from Acting Superintendent Joe Kelley on reopening schools...

Hi Folks - I am officially frustrated with the lack of solid dependable information from our state agencies and politicians. I know all of you are frustrated with the lack of information as well.

We thought we were ready to post reopening information to you our community. Then politics gets in the way and we have to start scrambling to see how our plan matches the changes posted yesterday. Yes, that's right, yesterday! As a result we are working to make sure we are in compliance with the changes.

Our intention is to push out some information Friday afternoon. The disclaimer will be that it may change if we have further last minute changes from the state.

Unprecedented times require unprecedented patience. We will get through this by working together.

Thanks,
Joe Kelley

Today, Nueces County put in-place a public health order that excludes face-to-face instruction for all school districts in the county until after September 7. Therefore, we will begin school on August 13th via remote instruction. We anticipate to provide remote and on-campus instruction beginning September 8th or when the health orders are lifted.

We are so thankful to our City and County leaders for ensuring the health and safety of our students and staff during these uncertain times. We also want to thank our colleagues in the surrounding districts who we have been working together with on this plan.

We will have more information on plans for remote instruction and eventually on-campus instruction next week.

Thank you for your patience while we navigate these unchartered and ever changing waters.

We want to ensure the highest level of confidence for parents and students to return to our campuses in August. Our goal is to provide a quality education with the health and safety of our students and staff at the heart of all that we do.
